dict.string: SnapNotion uses the camera to capture documents, images, and visual content for processing and organization.
SnapNotion accesses your photo library to import images and documents for intelligent content analysis and organization.
SnapNotion saves processed images and documents to your photo library when you choose to export them.
SnapNotion uses the microphone to capture audio notes and voice memos for transcription and organization.
SnapNotion converts your voice recordings to text using speech recognition for better searchability and organization.
SnapNotion accesses your contacts to intelligently tag and organize content related to people you know.
SnapNotion uses location data to add context to your captured content, helping organize information by location when relevant.
SnapNotion may access your music library to identify songs and media content you want to capture and organize.
SnapNotion sends notifications to alert you about processed content, task reminders, and collaboration updates.
SnapNotion integrates with file providers to import and organize documents from various cloud services.
